definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: And because the midwives feared God , he gave them families of their own .
sentences.chinese: 收生婆因爲敬畏神，神便叫她們成立家室。

sentences.english: And it came to pass， because the midwives feared God， that he made them houses.
sentences.chinese: 收生婆因爲敬畏神，神便叫她們成立家室。

sentences.english: He refused to lumber himself with a family.
Policemen with families have to moonlight to make ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 有家室的警察必須兼差才能維持家計。

sentences.english: Because the midwives feared God, He established households for them.
sentences.chinese: 收生婆因爲敬畏神，神便叫她們成立家室。

sentences.english: And these are the names of the sons of Gershon by their families; Libni, and Shimei.
sentences.chinese: 革順的兒子，按着家室，是立尼，示每。

sentences.english: And because the midwives feared God, he gave them families.
sentences.chinese: 收生婆因爲敬畏神，神便叫他們成立家室。

sentences.english: And the chief of the house of the father of the families of the Kohathites shall be Elizaphan the son of Uzziel.
sentences.chinese: 烏薛的兒子以利撒反作哥轄宗族家室的首領。

sentences.english: Hestin, the goddess of the family, represented home life and family happiness.
sentences.chinese: 赫提斯是家室之神，像徵著家庭中的生命與幸福。

sentences.english: The Merarites were counted by their clans and families.
sentences.chinese: 米拉利子孫中各族被數的，照着家室，宗族。

sentences.english: Distribute the land by lot, according to your clans.
sentences.chinese: 你們要按家室拈鬮，承受那地。

sentences.english: The sons of Gershon； Libni， and Shimi， according to their families.
sentences.chinese: 革順的兒子按着家室是立尼，示每。

sentences.english: Do not be overawed when a man grows rich, when the splendor of his house increases;
sentences.chinese: 見人發財家室增榮的時候，你不要懼怕。

definition: to take a wife/to get married (man)
to marry for the second time/second marriage/second spouse
to settle down and get married (of a man)/to become a recognized expert
to give birth to a child or children
